parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It mentions political opinions in a general sense, not targeting any specific candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, explicitly inviting participation from a broad audience ("Vă invităm să ne acordați câteva minute pentru a ne ajuta să înțelegem mai bine opiniile dumneavoastră politice").</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post concerns political opinions, its primary objective is not to influence the vote for a particular candidate in the parliamentary elections. The stated goal is to understand political opinions through a survey. There is no explicit or implicit endorsement or opposition to any candidate.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Potentially True. The post could be considered a form of citizen journalism or academic research aiming to gather data on political opinions. The survey approach suggests a focus on information gathering rather than direct electoral influence.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion about a candidate or party. It presents a neutral invitation to participate in a survey.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2366547817054237</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while falling under the "POLITICAL" category, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post invites participation in a survey about political opinions, a goal that does not directly aim to influence voting behavior for any specific candidate. The lack of explicit or implicit endorsement of any candidate, combined with the survey's focus on general political opinions, distinguishes it from prohibited electoral propaganda.  The post's design and language are neutral, lacking the persuasive elements typically associated with electoral campaigning.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
